reviews.title: You Have Got to Be Kidding me!
reviews.text: You have got to be kidding me!! I've been using trip advisor for about three years and have found the reviews very helpful in making decisons on where to stay. However, reviews for this resort could not be more inaccurate. I cannot even believe people have rated this resort with 5 stars. They must be getting info from the hotels own website.

One thing that turned me off right away was the fact that we picked this resort because of the reviews. Also, because the resort website and travel agent said Costa Real was a "family resort" and spring breakers were not allowed to stay at the resort. My wife and I with two kids pulled into the resort and all there were was spring breakers. The noise was so loud at night we did not sleep very well. We even tried to leave the resort and stay elsewhere, but all the resorts nearby were booked.
reviews.title: This Resort Can Be Summed Up

reviews.text: Quite frankly, I would not give this hotel more than 3 stars maximum. Everything was sub-par. Drinks were aweful. The food was not good, except for breakfast. How badly can you screw up an egg??? I'm not sure where the room website pics came from, but the room we were in needed a serious facelift. We ate out two of the four nights while staying there, at an all-inclusive resort, if that tells you how the food tasted.
reviews.title: Just got back!!!Great from start to finish!!!

reviews.text: We toured and spent a day at Moon Palace. Very nice. When we go back, we'll be staying there.
reviews.title: Awesome holiday

reviews.text: I will say this as a positive note. Most of the staff were very friendly and tried to be helpful and the rooms were very clean. The resort as a whole was very clean. Bottomline, the price was right. I guess what they say held true in this case. You get what you pay for...
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation!
A Great Vacation
reviews.text: We stayed at the Gran Costa Real April 9-13. We made our hotel selection largely based on reviews posted on Trip Advisor, and we were very pleased with our experience. The resort itself is very clean and attractive. Staff members are in constant motion, cleaning, preparing the beach area, etc. As many others have stated, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

The only slight glitch we had was in our original room assignment. We booked through Vacation Express, and had selected the deluxe room option. This turned out to be a room with no view of the ocean at all, only the pool, and no balcony. The resort was full the first night so we had to stay in the deluxe room the first night, but we were allowed to switch the next day to a Junior Suite, which had a nice ocean view and a balcony. We were charged $20 additional per night to upgrade, but it was well worth it for the view. Our Jr. Suite was not as updated with marble floors, shower, etc as the deluxe room, but was more spacious. If booking again at this hotel, I would specify a renovated Junior Suite as it appears we just happened to be in an area of the building that didn't have some of the newer features that many rooms had.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great food..
Wonderful Place
reviews.text: As for the food and drinks, we were very pleased. Our favorite dining experience was at Gaviota's on their seafood night. Clemente, the waiter, took extra steps to make the birthday we were celebrating an extra special one. The buffet at Alvatros was consistently good for breakfast, lunch or dinner, with plenty of options and didn't require reservations. Be sure to plan ahead and book your dinner reservations early as those seemed to fill up quite fast for the three restaurants that required a reservation.

reviews.title: This place was cool!
reviews.text: We spent most of our time at the beach area. The service was great with people to assist you with chairs and drinks. As many people have stated, the beach area is small and the volleyball area does take up a large portion of that space, but it worked out fine for us. The water in front of Gran Costa is very calm, but it isn't as quite the same brilliant turquoise color that it appears to be at other resorts further down into the hotel zone. The kayaks were great and we really enjoyed exploring a little further out from the hotel with these, which were available for free from the beach area.

reviews.title: Not too good, but not too bad
reviews.text: Overall, a very good experience that I would recommend to others!

reviews.title: Awesome!!
reviews.text: Stayed 3/31- 4/8/2006 Went w/boyfriend and another couple had a great time! We cant wait to go back. The shows that they did every night @ resort we super! The food was good and service was excellent! Everyone @ the resort was very friendly, helpful & excellent english. Was never bored acivities going on all the time they did good job of that. A great place for people w/children as they have a great kid's center! The Resort offers package prices every night for people who want a night out of the town to the different clubs! COCO BONGO is a must!! Will be returning again!!!

reviews.title: Great Resort
reviews.text: Just got back April 2nd. What an unexpected pleasure the whole week was. Friendly, attentive staff(and lots of them)clean, efficent, good food and lots of variety. Yes the beach is a little smallish but it was fine. So fine we never once set foot in the pool the whole week.There is lots of things to do or (like us) you can just sit and soak it up for the whole week.
Never been to this resort or Cancun before. Both are a definite do over.
reviews.title: Very pleased!
Very Very Very Pleased
reviews.text: My fiance and I just returned from the Gran Costa Real on April 6/06. We were extremely pleased with our trip. We are both in our forties and have travelled to many places, including numerous trips to the Carribean as well as Europe and Asia. Our honest opinions of the resort are as follows:

POSITIVES: We would rate the Gran Costa Real as FANTASTIC for various reasons. The food was excellent! Absolutely no issues. The buffets were great and there were always many dishes to choose from. Maria's and Il Pescatore a la carte restaurants were also excellent. We purchased the lobster (HUGE!) for a $14US extra charge, which was well worth it. The bars offer many types of drinks (loved the sour apple maritinis and blue hawaian drinks!). Our room was nice, large and extremely clean. The walk-in shower was very spacious. The service was excellent and the staff were friendly and courteous. The Mexican Fiesta night dinner show was well worth it. MUCH better than what we have seen in terms of evening shows at other resorts.
reviews.title: wonderful, awesome vacation
Awesome resort for a good price
reviews.text: Just returned stayed March 21st-28th at this resort and loved it. As a single female traveling alone, planned this place at the last minute by reading the reviews. It was well worth the money and will return there again if ever going to Cancun.

reviews.title: Fantastic Value
reviews.text: I have just read the one out of two negative reviews for this resort. I have to disagree, I am from the US and met many from the UK, Canada, and Ireland all their children loved the kids care and the parents thought it was great and had an awesome time.

Personally, I had a blast met lots of friends from all over that have already emailed me and am looking to go back and meet some for a reunion. The staff is unreal, always attentive and at your service. From the first day there never had to ask for another beverage. I felt safe being alone and made some great friends not only with others but, the staff as well. Their English is great Espanol, they accomodate as well.
reviews.title: A Litte Disappointing
Amazing
reviews.text: I would and will take friends/family back to this resort. Ate at the Albatros and Giavota's, as well as room service, all to a delight. One night, I went out with some lads I met and ate downtown. Overall, the food, entertainment and the staff was wonderful.

We (4 other girls I met) got to bartend at the beach bar for us and others. The staff Luis, Omar, Julio, Nacho, Francis, Jonathon, Pilar, etc. they were working 16 hour days and happy about it. I must admit, I did tip alot, but not every drink but, they worked their butts off!!!!
reviews.title: The staff were terrific!
